contents.class: inline text-sm font-normal text-white italic p

contents.text: What to do in Cyprus in winter.

With all the summer fun over, the wintertime in Cyprus is traditionally much quieter and it might be difficult to find worthy activities and adventures. Fear not, Trackers Excursions have a cure for the winter blues that will keep you occupied right through to spring.

Besides our Private and Custom tours, which you can take any time you desire, we have a selection of guided tours to major attractions and the most interesting places on the island, which are worth seeing and experiencing in the wintertime. Winter tours have minimal activities, but maximum guided sightseeing with a healthy balance of travelling and free time to explore so everyone keeps warm and cosy, inside and out. Our winter tours are mainly for small groups, interested in seeking out snowy scenery and traditional festivities rather than embarking on a raft of outdoor activities.
You can rely on our expertise and passion for our Winter program, get in touch today to organize your adventure in Cyprus.
Explore the Winter Wonderland of Cyprus

A Winter Jeep Safari tour to Troodos Mountains is a must during your holiday in Cyprus. With plenty of off-road tracks to some of the highest peaks of Trodoos, you'll have a chance to see the snow on the mountain peaks. Visit one of the Islands many Monasteries for a short stroll around the sacred grounds and experience many more on this special tour.
Explore the famous landmarks of Ayia Napa

Visit the most beautiful landmarks on this unforgettable half a day Jeep Safari around the unspoiled East Coast National Park of Konnos. Don't miss out on the opportunity to visit the famous Ayia Napa Statue Park. It's great for the whole family, couples and even single travelers.
A guided tour into the unknown of Ghost-town Famagusta

Join us on an in-depth view of Famagusta and the ongoing state of affairs with the Ghost Town and the illegal occupation of our Northern territories. Visit this once glamorous city with us, see the deserted hotels on sandy beaches and visit the Old gothic city of Famagusta.
